newsitem.title: USA: Risk managers worry about employment liability.
newsitem.headline: Risk managers worry about employment liability.

text.p: A survey of risk managers at the Risk and Insurance Management Society's annual conference here found that more than 60 percent are increasingly concerned about employment liability.
The survey, the first in a daily series conducted by Price Waterhouse at the RIMS conference, found that more than 52 percent of risk managers are increasingly concerned about computer security.
Nearly 36 percent cited environmental liability and about 30 percent cited white collar crime as growing concerns.
Product liability was an increasing concern for about 27 percent of respondents, followed by intellectual property theft and then corporate terrorism.
Nearly one-third of risk managers said their company does not have a comprehensive disaster recovery plan in place, the survey found.
And more than half of the respondents said they use the Internet at least once a week as a resource for risk management information.
Price Waterhouse is one of the nation's Big Six accounting and management consulting firms.
